APPOINMENT OF PARMANENT PRINCIPAL TO DEYYANDARA CENTRAL COLLEGE 0849/07 01.

asked the Minister of Education : (a) Is he aware that,- (i) the Deyyandara Central College is a National School; (ii) a permanent principal has not been appointed for this school for many years now; (iii) the present acting principal has not qualified herself to be a principal; (b) Will she state,- (i) the reason for the omission of Deyyandara Central College despite the fact that applications have been called to fill vacancies on posts of principals in National Schools; (ii) whether the action will be taken to appoint a principal to this National School; (iii) if so, when it is? (c) If not, why?

, VEHICLES OBTAINED FOR MINISTER OF POSTS AND TELECOMMUNICATION 0887/07 05. . . .
( ( . . . ) (The Hon. R. P. A. Ranaweera Pathirana) - (1) : () (i) , ; (ii) ; (iii) ; ? () ?

asked the Minister of Posts and Telecommunication: (a) Will he inform this House, separately, (i) the number of vehicles obtained for the Minister of Posts and Telecommunication and the Deputy Minister of Posts and their personal staff; (ii) the basis on which these vehicles have been obtained: (iii) out of them, the number of vehicles obtained on hire or contract basis? (b) Will he state in this House from which institutions or individuals the said vehicles have been obtained, along with their names and addresses ?

(c) Will he state separately in respect of each vehicle, - (i) the types of such vehicles ; (ii) The amount of money spent on those vehicles and the amount of the money allocated for fuel, monthly and annually ? (d) Will he state, - (i) if drivers had been recruited for these vehicles, the basis on which they were recruited ; (ii) their salaries and allowances ? (f) If not, why ?

(ii) - , (iii) , (iv) , () ? () 1990 2003 , ? (i) () , (ii) () , (iii) , () 1990 2003 ? (i) , (ii) , (iii) - , (iv) (v) ? () , ? asked the Prime Minister, Minister of Internal Administration and Deputy Minister of Defence, Public Security, Law and Order, : (a) Will he state the following values in terms of SDR, market value and compare it against the GDP from 1990 to 2003 on per year basis,- (i) the trade balance in export and import separately; (ii) the service balance in receipts and payments separately; (iii) private transfers to the country; (iv) Current account balance and official transfers to the country?

(b) Will he also state the above mentioned values as a percentage separately? (c) Will he state movement of non-monetary capital from 1990 to 2003 0n a per year basis separately for,- (i) the private investment (Net); (ii) other private investments (Net) (iii) government transfers (d) Will he inform this House from 1990 to 2003 on per year basis,- (i) the overall balance; (ii) current account deficit as a percentage of Gross domestic Product (GDP) (iii) the GDP in rupees; (iv) the reserves of the country; and (v) how much is it as an import cover? (f) If not, why?

. . . POOR RELIEF ASSISTANCE TO MR. P. G. PIYASENA 0850/07 8. .

asked the Prime Minister, Minister of Internal Administration and Deputy Minister of Defence, Public Security, Law and Order,-: (a) Is he aware that, (i) Mr. P. G. Piyasena of Heinford Colony, Mapakanda, Nawalapitiya is poor person with no means of income; and (ii) Mr. Piyasena and his aged wife live on the public assistance allowance of Rs. 100/- received from the Government? (b) Will he accept that although Mr. Piyasena has been making requests for poor relief assistance provided by the Samurdhi Fund for many years, no such poor relief has been granted so far? (c) Will he take the necessary action to grant poor relief to Mr. Piyasena? (d) If not, why?

FIRST ANNIVERSARY OF INDUCTION OF HIS EXCELLENCY THE PRESIDENT 0851/07 9. . .

() (i) ; (ii) ; ; () , ; () , ? , , : () ? () (i) , , (ii) , ? () (i) ,, (ii) ? () , , ? () , ? asked the Prime Minister, Minister of Internal Administration and Deputy Minister of Defence, public Security, Law and Order, - : (a) Will he inform this House as to how much money has been spent on the first year anniversary of the induction of His Excellency the President? (b) Will he submit to this House, separately.- (i) the manner in which they have been spent by the Departments, Corporations, Statutory Boards affiliated to the government and the Ministry of Finance; (ii) as to how much money has been spent on banners, posters, newspaper advertisements and radio programmes ? (c) Will he state, - (i) who has prepared plans for spending this money; (ii) who has granted approval for that? (d) Will he submit to this House, the names and posts of the above officials along with the photo copies of the letters of approval? (e) If not, why?

, , LIQUOR SHOP IN MEEGAHAKOTUWA TOWN IN KULIYAPITIYA 0867/07 12.

asked the Prime Minister, Minister of Internal Administration and Deputy Minister of Defence, Public Security, Law and Order,-: (a) Is he aware that, (i) there is a liquor shop in the Meegahakotuwa town in Kuiliyapitiya ; (ii) there is a pre-school maintained by the Kuiliypitiya Urban Council in front of this liquor shop ; and, (iii) recommendations of the Police, the Divisional Secretary, the Grama Niladhari and excise officers have not been obtained for running this liquor shop ? (b) If so, will he inform the House on whose wish it is operated ? (c) Does he accept that the bus stop where school children board and alight, the court of law and the police station are all situated opposite this liquor shop ? (d) Will he take steps to have that liquor shop moved from this place ? (e) If not, why ?
( - , ) (The Hon. Karu Jayasuriya - Minister of Public Administration and Home Affairs) , . . . Question ordered to stand down..
LAND BELONGING TO KOTTUKUCHCHIYA GERMAN FARM 0996/07 15.

(ii) 29 , ? () (i) , (ii) , , (iii) ? () , ? () , ? asked the Minister of Lands and Land Development : (a) will he state in this House whether,- (i) a plot of land which is 138 acres in extent, belonging to German Farm, Kottukachchiya situated in the Anamaduwa Divisional Secretarys Division had been sold to the Managing Director of Green and Green Company of Nawala, Rajagiriya for a certain project ; (ii) another 29 acres of the same land have been sold to a person called Christopher at Eagle Motors, Kochchikade for some project ? (b) Will he state in this House whether,- (i) BOI, Sri Lanka approved project reports have been presented in respect of the aforesaid two plots of land, so sold; (ii) If so, what those projects are; (iii) on what basis these plots of land were sold ? (c) Will he take action to aquire these plots of land if they are found to have been transferred in an illegal manner and to take legal action against the persons who have transferred such lands against the law? (d) If not, why?

ANNUAL TRANSFERS OF MAHAWELI AUTHORITY OF SRI LANKA 0984/07 13. ( )

() (i) , (ii) ? () ? () , ? asked the Minister of Agricultural Development and Agrarian Services : (a) Is he aware that the persons whose details are mentioned below have been transferred contravening the provisions of Circular No. MA/ADM/15 dated 07.07.2006 issued by the Executive Director (Administration and Finance) of the Mahaweli Authority of Sri Lanka pertaining to the annual transfers of the said Authority, Section 3 of Chapter 111 of the Establishments Code and Combined Services Circular No. 3-2006? Name Designation Details of the Transfer Mr. M.A.Gunasinhge Administrative From Colombo Assistant to Zone C Mr. W.M.Ranasinghe Administrative From Colombo Assistant to Zone G Mr. A.B.A.C. De Silva Sports Officer From Colombo to Victoria Mr. K.A.D.I.S.Nana- Lands Officer From Colombo Yakkara to Walawa Zone (b) Will he inform this House,- (i) on what basis the aforesaid transfers have been effected; and, (ii) what are the anti-disciplinary acts committed against the Authority by the said officers? (c) Will he State the steps that have been taken concerning the rights of the said officers ? (d) If not, why?
: ... : ... PRIVILEGE : DEATH THREATS OVER TELEPHONE TO HON. A.R.M. ABDUL CADER, MEMBER OF PARLIAMENT

. . . ( . . . ) (The Hon. A. R. M. Abdul Cader) Hon. Speaker, yesterday 22nd May, 2007 at about 9.00 p.m. when I was in my residence at 67A , Abdul Gaffoor Mawatha, Colombo 3, watching the Sri Lanka versus Pakistan cricket match on TV, I received a nuisance telephone call to my handphone from telephone number 0786478622 threatening me with death. The caller who spoke in Tamil continued to scold me in filth for about 3.56 minutes. Two similar threatening telephone calls were received by me when I was at my Gampola residence on 16th April 2007, one at about 6.00 p.m. and the other at about 7.45 p.m. from telephone number 0786422272. Although these nuisance calls need not be taken seriously due to the prevailing security situation in the country, I thought of making this statement as a matter of Privilege in this House so that the Hon. Speaker could take appropriate action through investigations and provide me with necessary protection. Police entries have been made both at the Gampola and Kollupitiya Police Stations. Both telephone calls received by me are from Hutch service providers. That is all. Thank you.
) (The Hon. C. B. Rathnayake - Minister of Livestock Development) , . . .

, , . Whereupon MR. DEPUTY SPEAKER left the Chair and THE HON. GAYANTHA KARUNATILEKA took the Chair. [..3.02] ( )
( - ) (The Hon. Chandrasiri Gajadeera - Minister of Home Affairs) , , . , . , .
( . ) (The Hon. T. Kanagasabai) , .Hon. Presiding Member, how many minutes do I have?
( ) (The Presiding Member) You have ten minutes. .

( . ) (The Hon. T. Kanagasabai) Thank you. . 48 . 190 . , . 45,000 . , 15,000 . , , . . . - . - . , . , . , , . . . ; . . - . , - Sri Lanka Agricultural Service Officers . . , , . , . . proportionate , 12%, 6% . , , ?

. . , . , . . 55 . , . , . proportionate appointment . . , , , . , . . . , . . , 10 - 15 , . , . , . . Hon. Minister, I am very glad that you are here. We know your capacity and capabilities. I want to mention a few things. One is, about the appointment of programme assistants. Sir, there were certain officers such as co-operative inspectors, rural development officers and so forth. They were graduates but they were paid a very poor salary. They were paid according to their GCE (Advanced Level) qualifications. So since they wanted to further their employment or enhance their salaries, they got into the programme assistants' service. But after going there they found that they were not fitting in because they have their experiences, they have passed their efficiency bar examinations, they have undergone various trainings in relation to their earlier field of employment, and they wanted to get back to their original positions. Certain officers were allowed but

appeals of certain officers were rejected. They wanted to get back to their earlier positions. You must consider this, Sir, because they joined this service hoping to get better salaries and facilities. Now they feel that their decision was wrong. So, if you think their services are useful to the Government and the officers concerned too would benefit, please consider their request without strictly following the Establishments Code. The higher officers do not study these cases adequately. So, please look into this favourably. Secondly, I want to say something about the pensioners. Now you are paying Rs. 1,750 as a cost of living allowance to all Government servants. For the pensioners only 50 per cent of it is paid. So, please consider paying the pensioners 100 per cent. About this ethnic proportion, I do not know the correct word. When you take in people to the Government service it is done on a percentage basis. There is a circular on this. That is, a certain percentage of Sinhalese, Tamils and Muslims are recruited. This is not adhered to now. A few months ago, Sri Lanka Agricultural Service competitive examination was held and not a single from the Tamil medium was selected. This means we will not have Sri Lanka Agricultural Service officers in our area. These people are going to be the research officers, lecturers supervising the extension service and so on. So, in the long run we will have no officers. Earlier, if I remember right, the Sri Lanka Administrative Service had a special examination and recruited about 40 SLAS officers for the North-East Province. Because of the Official Language Act many of our Tamil officers have left their jobs and gone abroad. They retired on their own. So, there is a severe dearth of Tamil government officers. Even the North-East Provincial Council is run by the senior citizens. What I mean is, they are all retired officers. So, kindly look into this and follow this circular when you recruit people for Government Service. Other than this, I was talking about the salaries. When I was a government officer I was paid only Rs. 200 but I was able to buy two gold sovereigns. But now I do not think that could be done. . The present Director of the Pensions Department is a very nice man, very sympathetic towards the government officers. But there is a problem, Sir. The Director of Pensions cannot do anything unless the other departments co-operate with him and feed all the information to him. So we have to sort it out and do something because earlier also there were a number of circulars and newspaper reports to pay the pension to the Government servants soon after they retire. But I know of cases where for more than three to four years they have not been paid their pensions. They are all Government servants who were living on their salary - a hand to mouth existence. They are all worrying me because I was a Government servant. They are coming to me and worrying me always. Hon. Minister, you have to find some solution to this problem also.

) (The Hon. Karu Jayasuriya-Minister of Public Administration and Home Affairs) Let me first respond to the Hon. Kanagasabai. Thank you very much for highlighting some of the points that you wished to raise. I would assure you that the points raised by you will be certainly looked into and I would like to have a short discussion with you, so that matters can be discussed in detail and some meaningful steps taken with the Ministry concerned. , , , . . . 31 . . 25 . , , . . . . , . . , . . . . . .
